title: Update regarding BankOne
story_body:
In a quiet update, BankOne, the stalwart financial institution with a strong presence in the Midwest, has announced a series of personnel shifts within its regional management structure. Effective immediately, longtime employee and current Vice President of Community Development, Karen Thompson, will take on the role of Senior Vice President, overseeing operations in the company's Columbus and Indianapolis markets. Thompson, a 15-year veteran of the company, will be responsible for guiding the bank's expansion efforts in these key regions.

In related news, BankOne has launched a targeted marketing campaign aimed at promoting its services to small business owners in the Kansas City area. The initiative, which includes a series of workshops and seminars, is designed to provide entrepreneurs with the tools and resources needed to succeed in the competitive local market.

On the environmental front, BankOne has reaffirmed its commitment to reducing its carbon footprint through a series of sustainability initiatives. As part of this effort, the company has pledged to reduce energy consumption at its 150-branch network by 10% over the next 12 months. This goal is in line with the company's broader ESG strategy, which prioritizes environmental responsibility and community engagement.

In a nod to its strong roots in the community, BankOne has also announced plans to expand its employee volunteer program, which provides employees with paid time off to participate in local charitable initiatives. The program, which has been in place since 2015, has seen significant growth in recent years, with over 500 employees participating in 2022 alone. With a workforce of over 3,500 employees across the Midwest, BankOne remains deeply committed to giving back to the communities it serves.
